posts.cooked: We’re looking to use limelights botpose from April tags for part of our odometry, but I have been unable to find any documentation or an example showing how to take the botpose network table entries and fuse it with other odometry like swerveodometry. Say for example we want to follow a path in auto where the tags are only visible during part of the path. In pseudo code thinking we’d have to do: if(limeLightbotPoseIsFresh) {trueRobotPose = limeLightBotPose;} else {trueRobotPose = swerve odometry}. But without a limelight in hand I don’t know exactly what it outputs when no tags are visible. Does anyone have an example of how they’re handling this? I imagine hundreds of teams are attempting exactly this problem but I haven’t been able to locate a solid example. Thanks!

posts.name: Owen Busler
posts.cooked:
Take a look at SwerveDrivePoseEstimator (WPILib API 2023.4.1)

The addVisionMeasurement should be what you are looking for (assuming java)

This is from photon vision but a good example to follow: photonvision/photonlib-java-examples/apriltagExample at master · PhotonVision/photonvision · GitHub

Ah thank you very much that is exactly what we need! Is there any clear reason to go with photonvision over limelight if using limelight 2 hardware? I haven’t seen anyone do some real world comparisons of the two but photonvision does have better documentation IMO.

posts.name: Owen Busler
posts.cooked: I have not used the LL april tag tracking, but there is certainly good discussion on this in other threads.

posts.name: Puzzle
posts.cooked:
What does the addVisionMeasurement exactly do? Also how do you use predefined pose constants? Is there a way to set the origin to a specific point on the game field? The limelight spits out botpose_wpiblue and wpired but they have pose with respect to a certain point on the field. How can I use that?

Thank you

posts.name: Owen Busler
posts.cooked:
Puzzled:

What does the addVisionMeasurement exactly do?

The java docs have a pretty good description of what it does, but at a high level it combines your drive-base odometry with the vision odometry to provide you with a more accurate position on the field: SwerveDrivePoseEstimator (WPILib API 2023.4.3)

Puzzled:

Is there a way to set the origin to a specific point on the game field?

Take a look at the differnet coordinate references they use here: https://docs.limelightvision.io/en/latest/coordinate_systems_fiducials.html

You can always use the Pose2d functions to map once coordinate plane to another : Pose2d (WPILib API 2023.4.3)

If that didnt answer all your questions let me know!

posts.name: Puzzle
posts.cooked: Thank you. I assume we do not have to map the poses to another coordinate plane as the limelight wpi_blue pose array has the same origin as the one defined in FRC’s game manual right?

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
